title: Taito Games
content:
Who here has played and/or finished one or more of the following Taito games?:
[url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/bubble-bobble]Bubble Bobble[/url]
[url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/operation-wolf]Operation Wolf[/url]
[url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/puzznic]Puzznic[/url]
[url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/qix]Qix[/url]
[url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/rambo-iii]Rambo III[/url]
[url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/renegade]Renegade[/url]

And who has played and/or finished Sierra's [url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/dos/oils-well]Oil's Well[/url]?Groeten van Frenkel

title: lol
content: It's a running joke between my girlfriend and I that I will someday marry Bubble Bobble and have children with it. She refuses to let me own an arcade cabinet of the game. I love Bubble Bobble.

title: Do-do-do, da-do-do-do, da-do doo dodoo dooooo...
content:
I'm a great fan of Bubble Bobble, though I've not completed it yet. When I've got an SNES emulator setup permanently on my DOSBeast (or find an original arcade device), I'll get stuck into it.

I downloaded an MP3 of the brilliant chiptune theme in the middle of last year, and it's been my SMS ringtone ever since.

The other games don't ring any bells. *investigates*

Ah, Puzznic looks wonderfully familiar. I used to play Brix a lot back in the 386 days, and a few times since then, and never realised it was based on another game.

Oil wells looks fun, but the other games don't interest me. I'm not, and never have been, such a fan of Beat-'Em-Ups or anything in a "realistic" army setting.

title: Re: Do-do-do, da-do-do-do, da-do doo dodoo dooooo...
content:
Ah, no idea of those other games but I know Bubble Bobble. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I've played it but haven't finished it. Used to play it on cousins' C64 with cousins. Years ago (although C64 time was already long over at that time, they had got the olde machine somehow). And if I remember correct, the machine got broken while playing Bubble Bobble, thanks to my older cousin's sudden aggression. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

I made it to the last boss in BB on my TI-83+. Definitely didn't help my math mark though (I failed the class).--------------------

title: Re: Bubble Bobble cheats
content:
One of the reasons why I haven't published these cheats yet is that I haven't really figured out the cheats of Bubble Bobble yet.

For all the other games it's rather easy, but Bubble Bobble does something special with a hash function, I guess.

Here's a hint to get you thinking: has anyone tried playing one of these games in a DOSBox version with the debugger activated and looked at the debugger window while starting the game? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Also, I've found this text in a memory dump of Operation Wolf, but I don't know how to activate it:
[quote]Quote:[hr]
YOU FOUND THE
EASTER EGG!
CONGRATULATIONS
FROM ME TO YOU,
ENJOY MY GAME!



WILLIAM RIEDER
[hr][/quote]Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Bubble Bobble cheats
content: Hmm...something about Bubble Bobble trying to open a file called "BETA. AT"?  What have you discovered so far?<font color="#EEF2EE">[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]</font>

title: Re: Bubble Bobble cheats
content:
Cheats for the PC version of Taito's Bubble Bobble, created by John Butrovich of NovaLogic in 1989:
Create the textfile BETA.DAT with the following text:
[quote]Quote:[hr]FBkeR
FAAaQ
FBIxAs
FAWJA
FAVAAO
FBHEP

[hr][/quote]
Actually, the first letter doesn't matter. So you could change every "F" to an "J" or a "t" if you're John or tom [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] . Something similar holds for the other letters as well.
Make sure every line ends with a newline character that Windows uses (CR+LF, 0x0D0A). If you don't understand this, just press Enter [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] .
Line 1 enables cheat 1, line 2 enables cheat 2, etc. So when you only want to enable cheat 3, you create the textfile BETA.DAT with as line 3 "FBIxAs" and the rest of the file doesn't matter.

Cheat 1: In the bottem left corner of the screen a "2" appears. What this "2" means, I don't know.

Cheat 2: At the upper right corner of the screen it shows what kind of bubbles may appear in current the level. The first bubble is a water bubble, then a fire bubble, a lightning bubble and finally an orange E bubble that represents that EXTEND letters may appear in the current level.

Cheat 3: Press Alt+A to show which way the bubbles flow.

Cheat 4: When Bubble (player 1) is hit and he makes somersaults press F7 for extra health points. When Bobble (player 2) is hit press F8 for extra health points.

Cheat 5: Press j to get back 10 levels, J to go 10 levels ahead, m 1 level back, M 1 level ahead. You can use both Shift keys or the Caps Lock key on your keyboard to go from a j to a J.

Cheat 6: Something with writing the file COREDUMP.BB, but the game never gets to this code, I think.

I think there's also a 7th cheat, but the game never checks it.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Bubble Bobble cheats
content:
Wow, that's pretty good, that must've taken quite some time to figure all that out! Core dumps are usually written when a game crashes - maybe you could modify some code to do a divide by zero or something, and see whether the game writes out the core dump then.

I also can't see what the 2 means in cheat #1. It's not the number of players (unless it's the original number of players the game started with) and it's odd that it doesn't change.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Bubble Bobble cheats
content:
It took about a day to generate the right words for in BETA.DAT and figuring out how to active cheat #3-#6 and what they do.
Cheat #1 and #2 were easier because they show something on screen, so I know they really where activated and do something.

When you get to level 20 without ever getting hit, a secret door will appear that takes you to a secret room with a secret message written in a secret writing system similar to the Standard Galactic Alphabet. This also holds for level 30 and 40. When you get to level 50 without ever getting hit, a secret door appears that takes you to level 70.
Without the cheats I could get to the first secret room. But with these cheats I can warp to level 30 and go to its secret room and see with my own eyes that the message is exactly the same as in the secret rooms of level 20 and 40. And the secret door in level 50 really does take you to level 70.

They also say there are multiple endings in Bubble Bobble, but I don't see them. But looking through BUBBOB.DAT, I do see some text that indicates that there are supposed to be multiple endings in this version as well.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]
